intro: Amphinomia listioides, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive appearance. Amphinomia listioides is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
